business.headline: India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

IBM CEO Arvind Krishna explains why tech layoffs have increasedIBM itself announced plans this year to cut thousands of jobs as it shifts focus to areas like artificial intelligence consulting and software.

Tier-2 cities and women investors drive India's crypto boom: ReportIndia's crypto landscape is changing fast, with Tier-2 cities and women investors emerging as the strongest new drivers of growth, according to a new report.

Investing Rs 5,000 in mutual funds? Why you should not go for multiple SIPsAre you planning to start investing with a Rs 5,000 SIP and thinking multiple funds will give you better diversification? Expert says this common approach may actually weaken your long-term returns. Here's how.

Are real estate investments outpacing stocks? Study points to 15% returnsA new study suggests that Indian residential property delivered 15% returns over the past year, surpassing many equity portfolios and challenging popular narratives about real estate's investment value.

Rs 30,000 crore IPO wave is coming in December. What should investors knowDecember includes large names such as Meesho, ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company (ICICI Pru AMC), Clean Max Enviro Energy Solutions, Fractal Analytics, Juniper Green Energy, and several mid-size and SME firms.

Will gold hold above Rs 1.30 lakh? Here's what experts sayGold prices in India remained stable as traders waited for the outcome of the US Federal Reserve meeting, with attention on both international and local drivers amid market volatility.

Aequs IPO: Check latest subscription details, GMP and moreThe grey market premium for the Aequs IPO is currently around Rs 45.5. Based on this, the estimated listing price works out to approximately Rs 169.5, implying potential listing gains of about 36.69% over the upper end of the price band.

Having undisclosed foreign income? Why is CBDT urging taxpayers to review ITRsThe CBDT has launched the second NUDGE campaign, contacting taxpayers who have not disclosed foreign income or assets, and setting a deadline of December 31 for revising Income Tax Returns to avoid penalties.

Applying for Meesho IPO? Investors should be aware of these red flagsThe IPO will close on December 5 and the allotment will be finalised on December 8. Meesho is set to list on the BSE and NSE on December 10.

PwC India flags tax shortfall but says FY26 fiscal deficit still on trackWhen the government presented the FY26 Budget earlier this year, it expected gross tax revenue to touch Rs 42.7 lakh crore. PwC now believes the final number will be closer to Rs 40 lakh crore, signalling a shortfall of nearly Rs 2.7 lakh crore.

Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; HUL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 110.14 points as it recovered to 85,216.95, while the NSE Nifty 50 added 41.15 points to 26,027.15 as of 9:39 am.

Meesho vs Aequs vs Vidya Wire: Which IPO offers the best value?Meesho IPO was subscribed 2.46 times on Day 1, with retail investors bidding 4.13 times their quota. Aequs saw even stronger retail interest at 12.16 times, pushing its overall subscription to 3.56 times. Vidya Wires, a smaller issue, was subscribed 3.16 times overall.
1,232 IndiGo flight cancelled in November, aviation regulator probesThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation sought reasons from the airline over the cancellations of flight and delays in time.

EPFO ends Aadhaar–UAN extension: Will employers now face stricter ECR rules?EPFO confirms there will be no further deadline extensions for Aadhaar seeding with UAN, affecting ECR filing from November 2025.
Sensex, Nifty close flat as falling rupee sparks concern on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 31.46 points to close at 85,106.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.20 points to end at 25,986.00.

Transferring money to family to save tax: Smart move or legal risk?On the surface, it looks like easy tax efficiency. But experts say that while transferring money within the family is legal, using it as a tax-saving tool is far more complicated and can even invite scrutiny if not handled correctly.

Is a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly salary in metro cities really enough? CA answersA high salary may create the impression of financial stability, but metro expenses tell a different story. A chartered accountant has explained how a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly income can shrink rapidly once daily costs and EMIs are taken into account.

Aequs IPO fully subscribed: Is it a buy or skip?Aequs IPO has seen full subscription within hours of opening, drawing considerable interest from retail investors. Experts discuss the company's prospects, valuation, and investor considerations.

Are gold and silver heading towards record highs this week?Gold and silver prices in India have climbed sharply as the rupee lost ground against the US dollar, with market observers attributing these patterns to global economic indicators and currency stress.

entertainment.headline: Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur to marry Stebin Ben in January, venue not finalised Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon is reportedly set to marry singer Stebin Ben in January. While Udaipur is being considered, the family is exploring multiple venues before finalising details.

Jaya Bachchan on most disturbing phase of her life: Couldn't stop crying Jaya Bachchan opened up on one of the most difficult periods of her life at a recent session in Mumbai. The veteran actor and politician spoke about the phase when she couldn't stop crying.

Honour, privilege: Emotional Agastya Nanda recalls working with Dharmendra in Ikkis At the music launch of Ikkis, actor Agastya Nanda became emotional while discussing Dharmendra's involvement in the film and the family connection across generations.

Prime Video, ZEE5 and Sony LIV: Thamma, Kuttram Purindhavan and more This week, Prime Video, ZEE5, Sony LIV and MX Player bring a mix of horror-comedy, emotional dramas and intense thrillers. From supernatural stories to campus romance and gripping investigations, there's something for every kind of viewer.

Balakrishna hopes Akhanda 2 teaches Sanatana Dharma, celebrates Chennai roots At a Chennai event, Nandamuri Balakrishna shared his views on the upcoming film Akhanda 2, emphasising its role in imparting lessons of Sanatana Dharma to the current generation, and spoke about his personal and familial connection to Chennai and Tamil Nadu.

Waah Indigo waah: Elvish Yadav slams airlines amid massive nationwide delays IndiGo's massive cancellation of nearly 200 flights has thrown airports across India into chaos, leaving passengers stranded and frustrated. Elvish Yadav also expressed his frustration about the ordeal.

When Karisma Kapoor kept shooting for Biwi No. 1 despite her metal dress injury Karisma Kapoor sustained an injury while filming a song for Biwi No. 1, but insisted on completing the shoot the same day despite discomfort. Costume designer Ashley Rebello recalled the incident in an interview recently.

Scarlett Johansson in talks for The Batman 2 as Zoe Kravitz exits as Catwoman Scarlett Johansson is in talks to join The Batman Part II, marking a notable addition to the DC universe as filming is set to begin next spring. The sequel, directed by Matt Reeves and starring Robert Pattinson, will see a change in the cast with Zoe Kravitz unlikely to return as Catwoman.

Samantha's mehendi pics are a tribute to simplicity and Raj's silent love language Fresh images from Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding events in Coimbatore emerge online as friends and family share heartfelt posts.

Samantha shares new wedding pic with Raj, jokes about being his problem now Actor Samantha's playful social media caption about becoming Raj Nidimoru's problem after their wedding has drawn attention, with friends and family joining in to share joyful moments from the ceremony.

Netflix this week: The Girlfriend, My Secret Santa, Jay Kelly and more to watch Netflix adds a diverse lineup this week, featuring thrillers, festive specials and emotional dramas including The Girlfriend, Jay Kelly, My Secret Santa, and The Price of Confession. From holiday fun to intense mysteries, there's something for every mood.

Inside Deepika's glam at Goa wedding: Backless blouse, red saree, pure grace Actor Deepika Padukone recently attracted widespread attention on social media after attending Ranveer Singh's cousin's wedding in Goa. Her appearance and coordinated attire with Singh became the subject of significant online discussion.

Sobhita celebrates one year as Mrs with husband Naga Chaitanya Sobhita Dhulipala marked her first anniversary as Mrs with husband Naga Chaitanya. She shared an exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpse of their traditional Telugu wedding in Hyderabad.

Are You Sure 2 review: Jimin-Jungkook show is pure comfort TV Jimin and Jungkook return with Season 2 of Are You Sure?! streaming globally. The show blends chaotic fun with comforting moments, capturing fans' hearts once again.

Kartik Aaryan does Salman Khan's towel dance, Kajra re at sister's haldi. Watch Actor Kartik Aaryan joined family and friends in Gwalior to celebrate his sister Kritika Tiwari's pre-wedding festivities, dancing at her haldi ceremony. Several pictures and videos from the celebrations have emerged online.

Yami Gautam slams extortion-like culture, paid negativity ahead of Dhurandhar Yami Gautam criticised Bollywood's growing "extortion-like" hype and paid negativity culture in a detailed note. She defended husband Aditya Dhar's hard work on Dhurandhar and urged the industry to unite against toxic practices.

Bride asks SRK to say zubaan kesari at Delhi wedding, his witty reply goes viral A viral video from a recent wedding in Delhi captures Shah Rukh Khan navigating a playful request to repeat his iconic zubaan kesari advertisement line.

Rashmika cheers as Pushpa 2 sets sight on Japan release. Check date, details Director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule, starring Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna and Fahadh Faasil, is preparing for a theatrical release in Japan. The film will hit Japanese theatres in January 2026.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 102: Tanya, Amaal, Malti call out Gaurav as fake, opportunist As the Bigg Boss 19 finale approaches, tensions spike during an Open Mic night where Tanya, Amaal, Malti and Farrhana accuse Gaurav of being "fake" and "opportunistic." Despite roast sessions and heated arguments, the episode ends on a calmer note with reconciliations and Farrhana's poem.

general news.headline: Just two friends in a car: Vladimir Putin on his viral carpool with PM ModiIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic two-day state visit to India.

India, Russia seal $2-billion submarine deal ahead of Putin's Delhi visitNuclear-powered submarines are considered far more advanced than diesel-electric vessels as they can remain submerged longer, operate more quietly, are typically larger, and are harder to detect.

Over 200 IndiGo flights cancelled today, total chaos at airportsThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation has called IndiGo officials for a meeting amid ongoing operational disruptions causing flight cancellations and delays.

General retired, imposter: Pakistanis mock Asim Munir's appointment delayAsim Munir: In technical terms, Pakistan is currently without a serving army chief or a Chief of Defence Forces in place. The new CDF post would have made Asim Munir the most powerful man in Pakistan. But, the Sharif government has not issued a notification yet.

Do you have any regrets? Putin said this to India Today's Editor-in-ChiefIndia Today got a glimpse of one of the world's most scrutinised leaders when the group's Editor-in-Chief, Aroon Purie, and Vice Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief, Kalli Purie, interacted with the Russian President in Moscow ahead of his India visit.

PM Modi not one to give in to pressure: Vladimir Putin to India TodayIn a major world exclusive, Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke to India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan at the Kremlin ahead of his historic visit to India.

Why question Deoband visit? Taliban leader slams Pak PM, asserts right to India tiesAfghanistan's acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi asserted Taliban-led Afghanistan's right to trade and political rights to ties with India. Pakistan has been critical of Delhi-Kabul relations. Muttaqi also rubbished Islamabad's allegations of Indian-backed militancy in Balochistan.

S-500 on India's radar: How this missile can hit satellites in spaceThe S-500 represents a leap beyond the S-400, with a 600 km range for ballistic targets and interception altitudes up to 200 km, reaching low Earth orbit (LEO).

India's economy is booming, but why is the rupee tumbling?India's economic growth is surging, yet the rupee keeps weakening as global risks rise and dollar demand expands. Why is a growing economy unable to prevent its currency from sliding further?

2nd Test, Day 1 Live: ENG 235/6, Root hunts maiden Test hundred in AustraliaAUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score: Joe Root is pushing for his maiden Test hundred in Australia. After back to back wickets of Ben Stokes and Jamie Smith, Root has steadied the innings alongside Will Jacks.

Raj Nidimoru's ex-wife Shhyamali says no to drama after his marriage to SamanthaShhyamali De broke her silence with a note three days after ex-husband Raj Nidimoru married Samantha at the Isha Yoga Center. She thanked well-wishers and firmly said she wasn't seeking drama or attention.

CCTV video: Businessman killed after being hit by speeding car in GurugramA 58-year-old businessman was killed in a hit-and-run incident in the DLF 2 area of Gurugram after a speeding car hit him while he was cycling. The entire incident was captured on CCTV, and police are currently reviewing the footage to identify and locate the car involved.

Tell my boss to not fire me: IndiGo flyer's plight mirrors thousands' todayDespite repeated pleas at help desks and boarding gates, many IndiGo passengers claimed they were left without any staff support or announcements even as flights continued to be cancelled or delayed for hours.

Tradition broken: Rahul Gandhi slams government for no Opposition-Putin meetSpeaking to reporters, Rahul Gandhi said that successive governments once ensured visiting foreign leaders met both the Treasury and Opposition benches, but alleged the current dispensation has broken that tradition.

Smog in the air, fog in the brain: Delhi's tree-pruning madness peaks at AQI 400The tag on shops, "We have no branches anywhere", can't be an advertisement for trees in Delhi, which is battling an air emergency. There is no logic why government staffers with greased palms should be going about lopping entire branches of trees in the name of pruning with an AQI above 400. There's smog, and there's brain fog.

Techie dies by suicide, cites harassment by neighbours, civic staff in noteA software engineer in Bengaluru died by suicide at his under-construction building after alleged harassment by two relatives who demanded Rs 20 lakh. His mother's complaint alleges they involved BBMP staff to pressure him. Police registered an FIR against the accused.

The rise of the 'AQI Holiday': Why forests are becoming India's new luxury escapesWe used to pick weekend destinations based on mood; head to the hills for romance, beaches for fun, a hotel with a decent spa whenever we needed pampering. Today, however, our travel plans begin with a universal question: "How bad is the AQI there?"
I am a doctor and here's what I know how older adults can prevent fallsA geriatrician shares her experience with older patients about healthy ageing - physically, mentally, and emotionally.

India's 1:811 doctor ratio is great on paper. But rural reality is another storyIndia's doctor-population ratio of 1:811 sounds impressive and even surpasses WHO norms, but this national average hides deep inequalities. Urban centres overflow with doctors while rural and tribal districts struggle with vacant PHCs, absent specialists and weak infrastructure, exposing India's persistent and widening doctor-distribution crisis.

RoKo's future being decided by people who have not achieved much: Harbhajan SinghIND vs SA: Harbhajan Singh's pointed remarks questioning those deciding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures have reignited debate within Indian cricket. His comments land amid rising rumours of tension involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and the senior duo.

Samantha's mehendi pics are a tribute to simplicity and Raj's silent love languageFresh images from Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Raj Nidimoru's wedding events in Coimbatore emerge online as friends and family share heartfelt posts.

Live: Lok Sabha debates Health Security se National Security Cess Bill, 2025Parliament Winter Session Live Updates: The Opposition walked into Parliament on the third day of the Winter Session wearing gas masks, using the symbolism to flag Delhi's worsening air pollution. Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi pressed for Parliament to list the country's deteriorating air quality as part of its business and open a debate on it. Hours earlier, INDIA bloc floor leaders had met to map out their strategy after the Centre agreed to the Opposition's demand for a debate on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral roll. 

The breakthrough came after Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla convened an all-party meeting in the wake of repeated washouts. With the deadlock eased, the Lok Sabha will now take up the SIR as part of a wider debate on electoral reforms next Tuesday, December 9. Both sides have also agreed to hold a discussion marking 150 years of "Vande Mataram". Meanwhile, Rajya Sabha floor leaders are expected to draw up the schedule for debating these two subjects, but the Upper House will wait for the Lok Sabha to finish its discussions before taking them up. Stay tuned with India Today for all Live Updates.

Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil expelled from Congress over rape casesRahul Mamkootathil, Kerala's suspended Palakkad MLA, has now been expelled from Congress. His anticipatory bail was denied in a rape case. A second rape FIR was also registered against him.

No degree? Zoho will still hire you, says CEO Sridhar VembuZoho's Sridhar Vembu has publicly stated that a college degree is not needed for employment at his company. In a recent exchange on social media, Vembu called on Indian parents and companies to pay attention to shifting attitudes toward higher education, referencing trends in the US and Zoho's own hiring practices.

Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur to marry Stebin Ben in January, venue not finalisedKriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon is reportedly set to marry singer Stebin Ben in January. While Udaipur is being considered, the family is exploring multiple venues before finalising details.

sports.headline: Hardik Pandya fan craze triggers SMAT venue change as crowds overwhelm organisers Hardik Pandya's return to domestic cricket sparked unprecedented fan chaos in Hyderabad, forcing officials to shift Baroda's SMAT match to a larger venue. His comeback has reignited excitement and raised expectations ahead of India's T20 assignments.

How does the World Cup 2026 draw work? A look at how 48 teams will be grouped The FIFA World Cup 2026 draw is all set to take place at the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C, on Friday, December 5. Here's a look at how the draw will take place and how the teams will be grouped.

RoKo's future being decided by people who have not achieved much: Harbhajan Singh IND vs SA: Harbhajan Singh's pointed remarks questioning those deciding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures have reignited debate within Indian cricket. His comments land amid rising rumours of tension involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and the senior duo.

Starc breaks Wasim Akram's record, becomes left-arm pacer with most Test wickets Mitchell Starc went past Wasim Akram to become the left-arm pacer with the most number of wickets in Test cricket history.

DSP Richa Ghosh begins duty as ACP Siliguri after World Cup success After playing a key role in India's World Cup triumph, Richa Ghosh starts her new journey in uniform as ACP Siliguri, taking up duties soon after receiving her DSP appointment.

Ruturaj Gaikwad for 2027 ODI World Cup? R Ashwin urges long run for CSK captain IND vs SA: Ruturaj Gaikwad's first ODI hundred has sparked fresh debate about India's batting order, with Ashwin saying the team must find space for him even when Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill return.

Irfan Pathan blames Ravindra Jadeja disappointing knock for Raipur loss IND vs SA: South Africa beat India on Wednesday, in the 2nd ODI of the series. Irfan Pathan blamed India's death overs batting for the loss despite the hosts hitting a total of 358 runs.

Why Cameron Green's IPL 2026 bidding war can't cross Rs. 18 Crore mark Cameron Green is expected to live the millionaire dream during the IPL 2026 auction, with many teams interested in him. However, the all-rounder cannot be sold for more than Rs. 18 Crores.

Age does not matter till Rohit, Kohli continue performing with bat: Tim Southee IND vs SA: Tim Southee feels that age does not matter for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma till they keep contributing runs in ODI cricket. Southee believes that India should carry the greatest ODI player of all time to the ODI World Cup 2027.

Mumbai Indians acquire Oval Invincibles in the Hundred, new name revealed Reliance Industries, owners of the Mumbai Indians, and Surrey County Cricket Club have entered a partnership, officially announcing the renaming of the Oval Invincibles franchise to MI London in The Hundred.

Rohit Sharma's eyelash falls, Pant's has the most millennial reaction ever IND vs SA: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and opener Rohit Sharma shared a hilarious moment in India and South Africa's 2nd ODI match in Raipur. The incident sparked massive nostalgia amongst the millennials.

Southee believes that India should carry the greatest ODI player of all time to the ODI World Cup 2027.

Mumbai Indians acquire Oval Invincibles in the Hundred, new name revealed Reliance Industries, owners of the Mumbai Indians, and Surrey County Cricket Club have entered a partnership, officially announcing the renaming of the Oval Invincibles franchise to MI London in The Hundred.

Rohit Sharma's eyelash falls, Pant's has the most millennial reaction ever IND vs SA: Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant and opener Rohit Sharma shared a hilarious moment in India and South Africa's 2nd ODI match in Raipur. The incident sparked massive nostalgia amongst the millennials.

Premier League: Arsenal grind out Brentford win, Chelsea suffer shock lossArsenal reinforced their position at the top of the Premier League with a disciplined win against Brentford, extending their unbeaten run. Chelsea, meanwhile, suffered a home defeat to Leeds United, slipping further behind in the title race.

A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak endsVirat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

What Gautam Gambhir told Ruturaj Gaikwad after giving No.4 role? India batter revealsIndia batter Ruturaj Gaikwad revealed the message he got from Gautam Gambhir after being told to play the role of No.4 during the South Africa ODIs. Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred during the match in Raipur.

2nd Test, Day 1 Live: ENG 235/6, Root hunts maiden Test hundred in AustraliaAUS vs ENG, Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score: Joe Root is pushing for his maiden Test hundred in Australia. After back to back wickets of Ben Stokes and Jamie Smith, Root has steadied the innings alongside Will Jacks.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weaknessSouth Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

Leader and mentor: Virat Kohli's double role in Raipur earns praise from GavaskarVirat Kohli did more than score runs in the Raipur ODI. He steadied a nervous Ruturaj Gaikwad after a brutal first-ball bouncer from Marco Jansen, helping him settle before he struck his maiden ODI hundred. Sunil Gavaskar praised Kohli's leadership and mentorship during the key partnership.

Jadeja the culprit? KL Rahul admits late-overs slump as India fail to defend 359IND vs SA, 2nd ODI: South Africa's record chase exposed India's lack of a finishing kick and the impact of relentless dew, prompting KL Rahul to admit his side left crucial runs on the field in Raipur.

Virat Kohli, Ruturaj Gaikwad tons not enough as SA chase 359 in dewy RaipurIndia vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: South Africa scripted the joint-highest successful chase by a visiting team in ODIs in India when they gunned down 359 on a dewy evening. India finished second-best in Raipur despite hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

Sports Minister leads talks to end Indian football impasse, confronts AIFF on issuesSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met AIFF officials, club representatives and prospective bidders to address Indian football's financial and structural crisis. He questioned leadership lapses, heard stakeholder concerns and promised a plan to end the ongoing stalemate.

Smoke shisha, talk cricket: MS Dhoni's open-door CSK routine revealed by ex-teammateMichael Hussey lifts the lid on MS Dhoni's relaxed and welcoming team culture at CSK, sharing stories of open-room hangouts, shisha sessions and Dhoni's surprising lack of keeping practice.

Irritated by media attention, Stokes snaps at Aussie reporter over e-scooter rowAshes: A tense standoff unfolded between Ben Stokes and a reporter in Brisbane after the England captain and teammates were questioned about not wearing helmets while riding e-scooters.

Aiden Markram first visiting SA opener to hit hundred vs India in a decadeAiden Markram scored a superb 110 to become the first South African opener in ten years to make an ODI century in India. His dismissal marked a turning point as India regained control in a high-scoring match.

Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century and roadmap to 2027 World CupIND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored his 53rd ODI hundred in Raipur on Wednesday. The former captain hit back-to-back hundreds against South Africa, raising the hopes of his place in the 2027 ODI World Cup squad.

Ashes 2025-26: All you need to know about the pink-ball Test in BrisbaneAustralia aim to extend their dominance in day-night Tests as England looks to rebound from a heavy Perth defeat. With pitch conditions, twilight swing, and late-week storms in play, the Gabba pink-ball clash promises a decisive early twist in the 2025 Ashes.

T20 specialist Mohit Sharma announces retirement from all formats of cricketMohit Sharma, 37, retired from all formats of cricket on December 3. The former Delhi Capitals and Chennai Super Kings bowler made an impact as a death bowler in T20 cricket.

Rinku Singh deserves a place: Fans slam batter's snub from IND vs SA T20I seriesIND vs SA: Rinku Singh's exclusion from India's T20I squad for the South Africa series has sparked widespread fan outrage. With the T20 World Cup 2026 looming, many believe his strike-rate and finishing skills made him indispensable — yet he remains overlooked.

Virat Kohli addicted to scoring centuries: Cricket world celebrates 53rd ODI 100IND vs SA: Virat Kohli's back-to-back centuries have reasserted his dominance in ODI cricket at the perfect moment. With a World Cup year approaching, the King looks firmly back in his most unstoppable rhythm.

Rohit Sharma unveils India's new jersey for 2026 T20 World CupRohit Sharma unveiled India's new jersey for the 2026 T20 World Cup during the mid-innings break of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur on Wednesday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
